inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: SCVMM Service Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: SCVMM connection to configure before running any SCVMM operation

inputs.name: Action
inputs.label: Action

options.NewVM: New Virtual Machine using Template/stored VM/VHD

inputs.helpMarkDown: Action to be performed on the SCVMM virtual machines.

inputs.name: NewVMsFromTemplates
inputs.label: Create virtual machines from VM Templates
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose this option for creating virtual machines from VM Templates

inputs.name: NewVMsFromTemplatesVMList
inputs.label: Virtual machine names
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the names of virtual machines to create. Enter only one VM per line

inputs.name: VMTemplateSources
inputs.label: VM template names
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the source VM templates in the order the virtual machine names are provided. Enter only one VM template per line.

inputs.name: computerNameFromTemplate
inputs.label: Set computer name as defined in the VM template
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this option is chosen, the computer name of the VM will set as defined in the corresponding VM template. Else, the computer name is same as that of virtual machine name

inputs.name: NewVMsFromStoredVMs
inputs.label: Create virtual machines from stored VMs
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose this option for creating virtual machines from stored VMs

inputs.name: NewVMsFromStoredVMsVMList
inputs.label: VM names
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the  names of virtual machines to create. Enter only one VM name per line.

inputs.name: StoredVMSources
inputs.label: Stored VMs
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the source stored VM names in the order the virtual machine names are provided. Enter only one stored VM name per line.

inputs.name: NewVMsFromVhds
inputs.label: Create virtual machines from vhd
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose this option for creating virtual machines from VHD

inputs.name: NewVMsFromVhdsVMList
inputs.label: VM names
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the names of virtual machines to create. Enter only one VM name per line.

inputs.name: VhdSources
inputs.label: Vhd's
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the source VHD/VHDX in the order the virtual machine names are provided. Enter only one VHD/VHDX per line.

inputs.name: CpuCount
inputs.label: CPU count
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the number of processor cores required for the virtual machines.

inputs.name: Memory
inputs.label: Memory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the memory(in MB) required for the virtual machines.

inputs.name: ClearNetworkAdapters
inputs.label: Clear existing network adapters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choosing this option will clear all the existing network adapters for the virtual machines created. You can add a new network adapter by providing VM network info below.

inputs.name: VMNetworkName
inputs.label: VM network name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of an existing VM network to be added to the virtual machines. Leaving this option empty will ensure virtual machines have no network adapters.

inputs.name: VMNetworkSubnetName
inputs.label: VM network subnet name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the VM subnet name, if exists, for the VM network provided above.

inputs.name: VMList
inputs.label: VM Names
inputs.visibleRule: Action == CreateChekPoint || Action == DeleteChekPoint || Action == Restore || Action == StartVM || Action == StopVM || Action == DeleteVM
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a comma separated list of the VM names. For example, FabrikamWeb, FabrikamDB, FabrikamTest.

inputs.name: CheckPointName
inputs.label: Checkpoint Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check point name
inputs.visibleRule: Action == Restore || Action == CreateChekPoint || Action == DeleteChekPoint

inputs.name: CheckPointDescription
inputs.label: Description For Checkpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the Description for new checkPointName

inputs.name: ScopeFilter
inputs.label: Select VMs From
inputs.visibleRule: Action == Restore || Action == CreateChekPoint || Action == DeleteChekPoint || Action == StopVM || Action == StartVM || Action == DeleteVM
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the filter for Virtual Machine

inputs.name: ScopeFilterForNewVM
inputs.label: Deploy the VMs to
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the filter for VMs

inputs.name: CloudFilter
inputs.label: Cloud Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Cloud name to filter the VM

inputs.name: HostFilter
inputs.label: Host Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Host name to filter the VM

inputs.name: CloudFilterForNewVM
inputs.label: Cloud Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Cloud name to filter the VM

inputs.name: HostFilterForNewVM
inputs.label: Host Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Host name to filter the VM

inputs.name: RemoveVMNetwork
inputs.label: Remove VMNetwork
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this option is selected, then any VM Network associated with the VM ( and not associated with any other VM ) will be removed.

inputs.name: VMPath
inputs.label: Placement path for VM
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify virtual machine path to be used during virtual machine placement. The path provided should be a valid placement path listed under VMPaths property for the provided Host. For example, path on the host machine - 'C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Hyper-V'

inputs.name: NewVMAdditionalArgs
inputs.label: Additional Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the additional arguments for command to create new virtual machine using template

inputs.name: ScriptType
inputs.label: Script Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Type of script: FilePath or Inline Script

inputs.name: ScriptPath
inputs.label: Script Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of powershell script. Should be fully qualified path or relative to the default working directory.

inputs.name: Inline
inputs.label: Inline Script
inputs.defaultValue:
# You can write your SCVMM scripts inline here. 
# You can also pass predefined and custom variables to this script using arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the script to execute.

inputs.name: ScriptArguments
inputs.label: Script Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional parameters to pass to PowerShell. Can be either ordinal or named parameters.

inputs.name: WorkingFolder
inputs.label: Working folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Current working directory when script is run. Defaults to the folder where the script is located.

inputs.name: WaitTimeToGetOSResponse
inputs.label: Wait Time
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify wait time in seconds for the Virtual Machine to be in ready state.

inputs.name: NewVMWaitTimeToGetOSResponse
inputs.label: Wait Time
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify wait time in seconds for the Virtual Machine to be in ready state.

inputs.name: NetworkIsolation
inputs.label: Network Virtualization
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose this option for enabling network virtualization for your virtual machines. You have to ensure prerequisites are met before enabling network virtualization [here](https://aka.ms/scvmmNetworkVirtualization)

inputs.name: ActiveDirectoryVM
inputs.label: Add an Active Directory VM
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose this option if your topology needs an active directory for your network virtualization setup. You can find more details about various topologies [here](https://aka.ms/scvmmSetupActiveDirectoryVM)

inputs.name: ADVMName
inputs.label: Active Directory VM name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name for the Active directory virtual machine.

inputs.name: ADVMStoredVMSource
inputs.label: Stored VM
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the stored VM to be used for provisioning active directory VM

inputs.name: ADVMDnsIp
inputs.label: DNS IP
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the DNS IP

inputs.name: ADVMDnsSuffix
inputs.label: DNS Suffix
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the domain suffix

inputs.name: IsVMNetworkAlreadyCreated
inputs.label: VM Network
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose this option to create a new VM network or use an existing network virtualization VM network.

inputs.name: IsolatedVMNetworkName
inputs.label: VM Network name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a name for your VM network. Ensure the VM name provided is unique.

inputs.name: IsolatedVMNetworkSubnet
inputs.label: VM network subnet
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a subnet for the VM network created. Use CIDR notation eg. 10.10.1.0/24. You can use any subnet of your choice from which the IPs are assigned to the created virtual machines. More details [here](https://aka.ms/scvmmNetworkVirtualizationSubnetRange)

inputs.name: LogicalNetworkName
inputs.label: Logical Network name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide an existing logical network to be used for creating the VM network. More details [here](https://aka.ms/scvmmSetupLogicalNetwork)

inputs.name: CreateBoundaryVM
inputs.label: Create boundary VM for VSTS/TFS communication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose this option to create a boundary VM which can communicate with VSTS/TFS. More details [here](https://aka.ms/scvmmBoundaryVM)

inputs.name: BoundaryVMName
inputs.label: TFS/VSTS boundary VM name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a name for the boundary virtual machine.

inputs.name: BoundaryVMTemplateName
inputs.label: TFS/VSTS boundary VM template
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the source VM template name for creating the boundary VM.

inputs.name: BoundaryVMExternalVMNetworkName
inputs.label: External VM network for boundary VM
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide an existing external VM network to be used for communicating with TFS/VSTS.

inputs.name: BoundaryVMExternalVMNetworkSubnetName
inputs.label: Subnet name for external VM network
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a VM subnet name for the external VM network if available. Leave as empty if no subnet name is required.

inputs.name: BoundaryVMAgentType
inputs.label: Boundary VM agent type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the type of agent to configure as a boundary virtual machine

inputs.name: BoundaryVMDeploymentGroupName
inputs.label: Deployment Group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide an existing deployment group to which the boundary VM is registered as deployment agent.

inputs.name: BoundaryVMAutomationPoolName
inputs.label: Pool name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide an existing deployment group to which the boundary VM is registered as deployment agent.

inputs.name: BoundaryVMAgentPAT
inputs.label: Personal Access Token
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide te PAT to configure the boundary VM agent against deployment group/automation pool. This input is required for configuring agent against VSTS or if TFS is configured to use SSL. If not specified, the agent will be configured using Integrated Windows Authentication with Negotiate.

inputs.name: BoundaryVMDeploymentGroupTags
inputs.label: Deployment group tags
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a unique tag so that the boundary VM agent will be used to deploy your applications to isolated VMs in the network.

inputs.name: BoundaryVMAutomationPoolAgentName
inputs.label: Agent name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a unique name for the boundary VM agent. Any existing agent with the same name in the same pool will be replaced

inputs.name: BoundaryVMAgentPath
inputs.label: Agent installation path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide an agent install path to configure deployment agent. This path should be a local path within boundary VM and agent installation files should exist in the specified path. This can be achieved by making agent install files available in boundary VM template during its creation. More details [here](https://aka.ms/scvmmBoundaryVMAgent)

inputs.name: BoundaryVMUsername
inputs.label: Boundary VM administrator
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the administrator user for the boundary VM. This user is used to connect remotely to the boundary VM and configure deployment agent.

inputs.name: BoundaryVMPassword
inputs.label: Boundary VM password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the administrator password for the boundary VM. This password is used to connect remotely to the boundary VM and configure deployment agent.

inputs.name: NoDetailedLogs
inputs.label: Show minimal logs
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose this option to avoid the detailed live logs about VM provisioning.
